intro: Milla potosina, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, vibrant blue or purple flowers. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and twining stems that climb or trail along the ground. It thrives in warm, humid climates and prefers well-drained soil. Milla potosina is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can be found in gardens and natural habitats across its native range.
